alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 5:52PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Brevard, Orange, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Sanford, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Wedgefield, Geneva, Chuluota, Lake Jessup, Bithlo, University Of Central Florida, Avalon Park, Goldenrod, Azalea Park, Maytown, Union Park, Lake Harney, Mullet Lake Park and Farmton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
